org.treetank.access

Class Session

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.treetank.access.Session
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISession

    public final class Session
extends Object
implements ISession

    Session

    Makes sure that there only is a single session instance bound to a TreeTank file.

      protected SessionConfiguration mSessionConfig
      Session configuration.

      • Session

        protected Session(Storage pStorage,
       ResourceConfiguration pResourceConf,
       SessionConfiguration pSessionConf,
       UberPage pPage)
           throws TTException
        Hidden constructor, only visible for the Storage-Class for instantiation.
        Parameters:
        pStorage - Storage for centralized operations on related sessions.
        pSessionConf - StorageConfiguration for general setting about the storage
        pResourceConf - ResourceConfiguration for handling this specific session
        pPage - to be set.
        Throws:
        TTException

      • close

        public boolean close()
              throws TTException
        Safely close session and immediately release all resources. If there are running transactions, they will automatically be closed. This is an idempotent operation and does nothing if the session is already closed.
        Specified by:
        close in interface ISession
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        TTException - If can't close session.

      • truncate

        public boolean truncate()
                 throws TTException
        Truncating the resource where this ISession is bound to. Note that the session must be closed first.
        Specified by:
        truncate in interface ISession
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        TTException - if anything weird happens.
